etymology.description: 甡 (shēn, "broom") + 又 (yòu, "hand") = holding a broom
etymology.interpretation: The character 彗 (huì, "broom") combines 甡 (shēn, "broom") with 又 (yòu, "hand") to depict the action of holding a broom. This emphasizes the function and use of a broom, suggesting an object specifically designed to be held by hand for sweeping.

examples.chinese: 他拿着破旧的彗(他拿著破舊的彗)，清扫庭院(清掃庭院)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná zhe pò jiù de huì, qīng sǎo tíng yuàn.
examples.english: He holds the old broom and sweeps the courtyard.

examples.chinese: 老匠人用彗(老匠人用彗)，细致打扫作坊(細緻打掃作坊)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo jiàngrén yòng huì, xìzhì dǎsǎo zuòfāng.
examples.english: The old craftsman uses the broom to meticulously clean the workshop.

examples.chinese: 在寒冬夜晚(在寒冬夜晚)，他默默拿起彗(他默默拿起彗)，清扫门前(清掃門前)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hán dōng yè wǎn, tā mò mò ná qǐ huì, qīng sǎo mén qián.
examples.english: On a cold winter night, he silently picked up the broom and swept the front door.
